Key Match Events: Iceland scored an early goal through Jon Dagur Thorsteinsson
England's defending was generous, with Marc Gu√©hi struggling in the centre and John Stones off the pace
Kobbie Mainoo and Phil Foden could get little going in midfield
England did not look like they believed they would equalise in the second half
Iceland had several big chances to score a second goal, but were unable to convert them
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate had taken a few uneasy breaths inside the first minute when Stones went down and stayed down, having got his foot tangled underneath Thorsteinsson after they tussled with each other and went to ground
Post-Match Reflections: The home fans were booed off at the final whistle, with thousands making for the exits before the end
Southgate's team flattered to deceive: lots of flicks, not enough power and conviction, the end product so frustrating
It was the worst possible start for England, with a poor performance and a lack of conviction
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a psychological test for Southgate's team, as much as anything else
Four of the starters had no experience of a major international tournament; ditto four of those who came on
England hinted at the equaliser after the restart, but were unable to convert their chances
Others: The match was a Euro 2024 warm-up for England, and was played at a sold-out Wembley
England's close passing was too intricate, too tight and Iceland were able to mass bodies behind the ball and make life difficult
